intro: Chorizanthe brevicornu var. brevicornu, commonly known as the narrow-beaked choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs, and the plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
